I loved the simplicity. The design allowed for the Tiny Home to feel quite spacious- beautiful open shower, tall ceilings, shelves instead of cabinets, and lots of windows. I could absolutely live here full time. And it would be the perfect getaway for anyone who needs to restore. My favorite touch was the work desk that was set up at the window. I am a writer so I considered it "my (temporary) writing table". The view of the trees with the visiting birds was just the inspiration I needed. I was blessed to be in this Tiny Home when the 2021 East Texas snow storm hit. What an unusual treat. The views of the snow falling from this Tiny Home were something I will never forget. I highly recommend this place for your own memory making!

Terri was going above & beyond before I arrived- she informed me of a vacancy in her 2nd cabin for the extra day I needed and graciously allowed me to switch my reservation(I didn’t have to stay at a hotel the 1st night in town this way.) The house was stocked with everything one would need for a short stay plus added amenities like snacks, wine, and my favorite: fresh eggs from Terri’s hens.
My girlfriend not only appreciated the cute decor that made the cabin warm & cozy, but she had no issue getting ready for a wedding in the tiny, but strategically-designed, bathroom space
I received permission to bring my dog and he loved running the property and swimming in the pond with Terri’s dog- the covered front porch was a favorite spot for dogs & humans alike to enjoy the peaceful ETX outdoors.
In case you needed more convincing that this is the space for a solo traveler or a cuddly couple, I spent my last morning packing my things, planning another reason to have a weekend getaway at one of Terri’s cabins.

Our family felt so at home at Cashrock Farm. We thought travelling for a funeral would be somber but watching Stranger Things on Netflix with our kiddos & walking in the mornings to the pond with our pup made it a wonderful vacation.
We brought our 19 pound terrier rescue & he loved morning walks to the pond. We had to leave our dog at the property for a funeral and reception. We travelled with our dogs kennel, this made things so much easier for us because he likes to sleep there and we made sure to be respectful of the hosts space while we were away for a few hours.
Some might describe the exaughst fan to help reduce condensation as noisy. We live in a city so it didn't bother us at all. And the temperature in this house while it was well over 100 degrees in the summer outside was so cool, a little rattle noise is well worth the comfort.
Our southern realtives all overwhelmed our aunt with food & we saved the day by storing food in the generous fridge at the property and we all had a big leftover dinner in the evening.
things we loved:
the bedding was so comfy & space clean.
location was easy to find & visit Southern Lufkin from our home base
the cleaning supplies available allowed us to keep everything tidy as we were there with teens for many days.
the hard cider was my wife's fav part of stay.
the washer and dryer was such a luxury & appreciated
small things we have experienced at other AirBnBs that might improve future stays:
A small box fan for the bunk bed room as that room gets stuffy with two teenagers.
list of local things like Rays drive in & the natural history museum that folks with kids might enjoy (we loved it)
More than one place to hang towels mb a hook behind door. The wet towel situation was tricky with 4 people and only one towel rack
We have stayed with a lot of hosts and this tops our list as a family favorite. 10/10 would stay again.
